meanings.definition: The highest mast on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The topmasts swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The sailors climbed the topmasts to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the topmasts, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The topmasts reached for the sky like towering giants.
meanings.sent5: The topmasts stood tall and proud against the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The crew worked diligently to topmasts the ship before the storm.
meanings.sent2: They will topmasts the vessel with a new mast next week.
meanings.sent3: The captain decided to topmasts the ship with colorful flags for the celebration.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to topmasts her room with fairy lights for a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The carpenters will topmasts the house with sturdy beams for extra support.

meanings.definition: The part of a mast above the topgallant mast.
meanings.sent1: The sailors gazed up at the topmasts, marveling at their height.
meanings.sent2: The topmasts were painted in bright colors to be easily spotted from afar.
meanings.sent3: A curious seagull landed on the topmasts, looking for a place to rest.
meanings.sent4: The topmasts stood out against the clear blue sky like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The topmasts creaked softly as the ship sailed through the calm waters.
